River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well tended crow's feet abound on the stars, and there's a great cast attempting their best against all odds. The result is a film that is often less than the sum of its parts, but that does manage to engage and entertain.

The only reason I am commenting is because I finally figured out why Dr. Cox was bald. Although we probably all realized it at the same time this week Dr. Cox is bald because he has Raynaud's syndrome. If you look carefully every time he is disgusted, annoyed, or stressed you can see his finger tips go white. His wife had gastric bypass and although I cannot have the surgery many of the reasons are identical.
Love your site and your show!!<|end_of_text|>

- Bad Stuff: This movie is real crap. Bad stunts for one thing, they looked so fake I thought this was "The Twilight Zone". The acting could be better, so bad are the effects that only movie nuts will appreciate the love that went into this steaming pile of amoebae with more sex appeal that any killer female creature/mama bug known to man. It looks as if the cinematographer was in a handheld director's chair, literally watching the movie

WHITE CHICKS Hold on, why couldn't they have dressed as Black Chicks, oh yeah, they wouldn't look different at all. Can anyone tell me how these two men can love being girls so much in the 1990s? Taking up all hair care, fashion care, material consumption, nails.... and all for what the men can eat and watch the same old TV nobody really gives a SSSSSS any longer.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

predictable, campy, bad special effects. it has a TV-movie feeling to it. the special effects are so bad, they are laughable. the animations of people walking in slo mo are laughable as is the tank that looks like a blender. the maze looks like egg crates and looks like you could shoot a hole through it with a fake plastic round. the sequel blows. i can't actually recommend

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and several skeletons and bodies half eaten. So what are they living with and more importantly who or what is killing them? Worth watching, good plot and character build.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Jerry MEA Culpa, kills Loveheart the mouse after a busy day at the pay toilet.
CHICAGO -- Working along with a new recent influx of immigrants, two old codgers try to cope with changes on their crumbling farm.
With the global

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more enjoyable Disney fairy tales, thanks to the heavy stress on the musical aspects. The fact that it was pretty much a success with kids is good evidence that “les petits are enough stupid to adore a movie without interest”, found out by labelling the musical climax with tuning fork frequencies

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy share their excesses (even with bugs) for fun at their Dungeons and Dragons parties. Who will win the battle of the bugs and enjoy dish love? Isn’t that the real question? Enjoy, and I hope you. Thank you!<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly a throwback to the 80's, has some decent fight scenes, and is ultimately enjoyable to watch if you're not looking for anything other than an action movie.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>
